title: CAPA logo/ID
content:
Ok, it happend again.   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020193312im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/22389.gif)   
   
I did a logo for a client which I think turned out very good, but now the company name was refused so they had to stick with CAPA and drops the & ASSOCIADOS for legal issues. This laywer company is named CAPA that stands for the K word in Portuguese. Now I have some problems on the original concept. Tell me where makes more sense to you the type position. Should I only stick with the SERIF and drops Avenir for the description? Please be free to try other positions ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020193312im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
Thanks, I'll show the full ID after finish the logo.

author: adriano

comments.content:
I think the mark is just too big for the type   
options you are showing. Try reducing the mark to   
50-65% of what it is and then pair it up with the   
type.

I think 1 and 4 is the best, leaning against 4... Try make the right side of the type aligned with eachother making an impression of the verical bar of the "k".   
   
/f

Thanks for the feedback. I'm also into the #4 as it seems more "balanced". How about this:   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020193312im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/22415.gif)

the "k" seems to float around, it has no real anchor.   
What about aligning the "k" to the type like this?   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020193312im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/22460.jpg)   
   
/f
I like that a lot (anchoring the K like that) it really makes it work now with the type.

Adriano, I would work on the the last suggestion from the first group you have uploaded (the one with thin vertical line dividing CAPA from sociedade...). My suggestion is to align the K sign's lower serif with the beginig of "sociedade". This centered composition might be too rigid.   
   
The logo is beautiful!

Matjaz --   
   
Sorry off topic but, I love your thumbnail image.   
Very clevar. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020193312im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif) Made me smile.
